reviewText: I thank God and Jesus for one of the most funniest and most important directors that Warner Bros. ever had in their Golden Age. From what I saw in the videotape, it was before some DVNR'd DVDs from years ago and this video print quality was usually more superiorly cleaner and subtler, but more lesser than the Blu-Rays we see today. Pauly P.S. I thank John Kricfalusi for his more thoughtful and more helpful suggestion.Golden Age of Looney Tunes, Vol. 4: Bob Clampett [VHS]

THE GOLDEN AGE OF LOONEY TUNES  BUGS BUNNY BY EACH DIRECTOR

"The Heckling Hare"

"Hare Tonic"

"Hare Ribbin'"

"Bugs Bunny Nips the Nips"

"A Hare Grows in Manhattan"

"The Unruly Hare"

"Gorilla My Dreams"

 Note: This video was recalled due to pressure from a Japanese group because the tape contained "Bugs Bunny Nips the Nips". The 5-tape VHS boxed set was also recalled for the same reason.
